Bray.grammar: Hill | Bré ('hill', nominative singular, M) is a direct transliteration. Bré may be a variant or fossil form of brí, an old Irish word meaning hill or elevated place.

Dublin.grammar: Town of the Ford of Hurdles | Baile ('town', nominative singular, M) + Átha ('ford', genitive singular of áth, M) + Cliath ('hurdles', genitive plural of cliath, F).

Kinsale.grammar: Headland of the Sea | Cionn ('head' or 'headland', nominative singular, M, variant of ceann) + Sáile ('salt water' or 'sea', genitive singular, M, Cionn causes úru in Sáile in Early Modern Irish, hence tSáile).
